question: Can students interrupt their studies during the examination period without serious reasons?
answer_generated: No, students cannot interrupt their studies during the examination period without serious reasons. Interruption is only allowed for serious reasons during the instruction or examination period. Article(12)(6).
context:
Document 1: Study and Examination  Rules for Students  at CTU 
______________ _____________________________________________________________  
 
12 (6) The minimum  period  of interruption  of studies  is one semester;  in exceptional  cases  the period  of 
interruption  of studies  may  be shorter.   Studies  cannot  be interrupted  when  the regular  date and 
the retake  date  of the state  final  examinations  are held  in the course  of one semester.   During  the 
interruption,  the person  does  not have  a student  status.   In the course  of the instruction  period  or 
the examination  period,  studies  may  be interrupted  only  for serious  reasons.   Also  interruption  of 
studies  cannot  be granted  in case  when,  after  resuming  the studies  after  an interruption,  the 
student’s  studies  would  be immediately  terminated  pursuant  to Section  56, Para  1 (b) of the Act 
and Article  34, Para 7 (b).  The decision  of the dean  concerning  the interruption  of studies  is 
regulated  by Section  68 of the Act.  The dean’s  decision  in writing  is recorded  in the CTU electronic  
information  system  and is filed  in the student’s  documentation.
